org.conqat.lib.commons.io

Class ByteArrayUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.lib.commons.io.ByteArrayUtils

  • public class ByteArrayUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for dealing with raw byte arrays. This is located in the I/O package, as the typical application for these methods is binary I/O on byte array level.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteArrayUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • intToByteArray

        public static byte[] intToByteArray(int value)
        Converts an integer value to a byte array. The returned array has a length of Integer.BYTES.

      • storeIntInStartOfArray

        public static void storeIntInStartOfArray(int value,
                                          byte[] bytes)
        Stores the given int at the first 4 bytes of the array.

      • doubleToByteArray

        public static byte[] doubleToByteArray(double value)
        Converts a double value to a byte array. The returned array has a length of Double.BYTES

      • longToByteArray

        public static byte[] longToByteArray(long value)
        Converts a long value to a byte array. The returned array has a length of Long.BYTES

      • byteArrayToInt

        public static int byteArrayToInt(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array to an integer value. Overall, this method is only guaranteed to work if the input array was created by intToByteArray(int).

      • byteArrayToOptionalInt

        public static java.util.OptionalInt byteArrayToOptionalInt(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array to an optional int value, by mapping a null input array to empty.

      • readIntFromStartOfArray

        public static int readIntFromStartOfArray(byte[] bytes)
        Reads an int stored with storeIntInStartOfArray(int, byte[]) from the first 4 bytes of the array.

      • byteArrayToDouble

        public static double byteArrayToDouble(byte[] value)
        Converts a byte array to a double value. Overall, this method is only guaranteed to work if the input array was created by doubleToByteArray(double).

      • byteArrayToLong

        public static long byteArrayToLong(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array to a long value. Overall, this method is only guaranteed to work if the input array was created by longToByteArray(long).

      • byteArrayToOptionalLong

        public static java.util.OptionalLong byteArrayToOptionalLong(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array to an optional long value, by mapping a null input array to empty.

      • decompress

        public static byte[] decompress(byte[] value)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Decompresses a single byte[] using GZIP. A null input array will cause this method to return null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input array is not valid GZIP compressed data (as created by compress(byte[])).

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress(byte[] value)
        Compresses a single byte[] using GZIP. A null input array will cause this method to return null.

      • isPrefix

        public static boolean isPrefix(byte[] prefix,
                               byte[] key)
        Returns whether the prefix is a prefix of the given key.

      • isPrefix

        public static boolean isPrefix(byte[] prefix,
                               byte[] key,
                               int startIndex)
        Returns whether the prefix is a prefix of the given key when only looking at the part of key starting at startIndex.

      • isLess

        public static boolean isLess(byte[] a1,
                             byte[] a2,
                             boolean resultIfEqual)
        Returns true if a1 is (lexicographically) less than a2.

      • unsignedByte

        Returns the unsigned byte interpretation of the parameter.

        Returns the unsigned byte interpretation of the parameter as long.

        Returns the concatenation of the given arrays.

      • concat

        public static byte[] concat(java.lang.Iterable<byte[]> arrays)
        Returns the concatenation of the given arrays.

      • hexDump

        public static java.lang.String hexDump(byte[] data)
        Creates a hex dump of the provided bytes. This is similar to output from hexdump tools and primarily used for debugging. The output string will contain in each line 16 bytes of data first printed as hex numbers and then as a string interpretation. Each line is also prefixed with an offset.

      • hexDump

        public static java.lang.String hexDump(byte[] data,
                                       int width)
        Creates a hex dump of the provided bytes. This is similar to output from hexdump tools and primarily used for debugging. The output string will contain in each line width bytes of data first printed as hex numbers and then as a string interpretation. Each line is also prefixed with an offset.

      • startsWithZipMagicBytes

        public static boolean startsWithZipMagicBytes(byte[] data)
        Returns whether the given bytes start with the magic bytes that mark a ZIP file.

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(byte[] searchFor,
                          byte[] searchIn,
                          int startIndex)
        Returns the first index in searchIn at or after the start index containing searchFor (or -1 if not found).

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(byte[] searchFor,
                          byte[] searchIn,
                          int startIndex,
                          int endIndex)
        Returns the first index in searchIn at or after the start index containing searchFor (or -1 if not found). endIndex is the index of the first byte that is not considered in the match (exclusive).

      • split

        public static java.util.List<byte[]> split(byte[] bytes,
                                           byte[] separatorBytes)
        Perform a split with no limit according to split(byte[], byte[], int).

      • split

        public static java.util.List<byte[]> split(byte[] bytes,
                                           byte[] separatorBytes,
                                           int maxSplits)
        Splits the byte array at the separator bytes given maximum split amount of times. The result ArrayList is never longer than the maximum split.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to split. An empty list is returned if this is null.
        separatorBytes - Non null array of bytes to split at. Must have positive length.
        maxSplits - the maximum number of splits to perform starting at the beginning of the bytes array. An empty list is returned if this is 0 or negative.
